RNGFND5_WSP_FRQ.Description: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

RNGFND5_WSP_MAVG.Description: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

RNGFND5_WSP_MEDF.Description: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

RNGFND5_WSP_THR.Description: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

RNGFND6_ADDR.Description: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

RNGFND6_FUNCTION.Description: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

RNGFND6_GNDCLEAR.Description: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.
RNGFND6_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground

RNGFND6_MAX_CM.Description: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND6_MIN_CM.Description: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

RNGFND6_OFFSET.Description: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

RNGFND6_PIN.Description: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to.  Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

RNGFND6_POS_X.Description: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

RNGFND6_PWRRNG.Description: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

RNGFND6_RECV_ID.Description: The receive ID of the CAN frames. A value of zero means all IDs are accepted.

RNGFND6_RMETRIC.Description: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

RNGFND6_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

RNGFND6_SNR_MIN.Description: Minimum signal strength (SNR) to accept distance

RNGFND6_STOP_PIN.Description: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

RPM2_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM2_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RPM_MIN_QUAL.Description: Minimum data quality to be used

RPM_SCALING.Description: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

RPM_TYPE.Description: What type of RPM sensor is connected

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH

RSSI_TYPE.Description: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

AUTO_KICKSTART.Description: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN.Description: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.

AUX_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for auxiliary functions including saving waypoints

BAL_PITCH_MAX.Description: Pitch angle in degrees at 100% throttle

BAL_PITCH_TRIM.Description: Balance Bot pitch trim for balancing. This offsets the tilt of the center of mass.

CH7_OPTION.Description: What to do use channel 7 for

CRASH_ANGLE.Description: Pitch/Roll angle limit in degrees for crash check. Zero disables check

CRUISE_SPEED.Description: The target speed in auto missions.
CRUISE_SPEED.DisplayName: Target cruise speed in auto modes

CRUISE_THROTTLE.Description: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

FORMAT_VERSION.Description: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

FS_ACTION.Description: What to do on a failsafe event

FS_CRASH_CHECK.Description: What to do on a crash event. When enabled the rover will go to hold if a crash is detected.

FS_EKF_ACTION.Description: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

FS_EKF_THRESH.Description: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

FS_GCS_ENABLE.Description: Enable ground control station telemetry failsafe. When enabled the Rover will execute the FS_ACTION when it fails to receive MAVLink heartbeat packets for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

Values.2: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto

FS_OPTIONS.Description: Bitmask to enable Rover failsafe options

FS_THR_ENABLE.Description: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel to a low value. This can be used to detect the RC transmitter going out of range. Failsafe will be triggered when the throttle channel goes below the FS_THR_VALUE for FS_TIMEOUT seconds.

Values.2: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto

FS_THR_VALUE.Description: The PWM level on the throttle channel below which throttle failsafe triggers.

FS_TIMEOUT.Description: The time in seconds that a failsafe condition must persist before the failsafe action is triggered

GCS_PID_MASK.Description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

INITIAL_MODE.Description: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver. Usually used in combination with when AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN or AUTO_KICKSTART.

LOG_BITMASK.Description: Bitmap of what log types to enable in on-board logger. This value is made up of the sum of each of the log types you want to be saved. On boards supporting microSD cards or other large block-storage devices it is usually best just to enable all log types by setting this to 65535. The individual bits are ATTITUDE_FAST=1, ATTITUDE_MEDIUM=2, GPS=4, PerformanceMonitoring=8, ControlTuning=16, NavigationTuning=32, Mode=64, IMU=128, Commands=256, Battery=512, Compass=1024, TECS=2048, Camera=4096, RCandServo=8192, Rangefinder=16384, Arming=32768, FullLogs=65535

LOIT_RADIUS.Description: Vehicle will drift when within this distance of the target position

LOIT_SPEED_GAIN.Description: Determines how agressively LOITER tries to correct for drift from loiter point. Higher is faster but default should be acceptable.

LOIT_TYPE.Description: Loiter behaviour when moving to the target point

Values.0: Forward or reverse to target point
Values.1: Always face bow towards target point
Values.2: Always face stern towards target point

MODE1.Description: Driving mode for switch position 1 (910 to 1230 and above 2049)

MODE2.Description: Driving mode for switch position 2 (1231 to 1360)

MODE3.Description: Driving mode for switch position 3 (1361 to 1490)

MODE4.Description: Driving mode for switch position 4 (1491 to 1620)

MODE5.Description: Driving mode for switch position 5 (1621 to 1749)

MODE6.Description: Driving mode for switch position 6 (1750 to 2049)

MODE_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for driving mode control

PILOT_STEER_TYPE.Description: Set this to 1 for skid steering input rovers (tank track style in RC controller). When enabled, servo1 is used for the left track control, servo3 is used for right track control

PIVOT_TURN_ANGLE.Description: Navigation angle threshold in degrees to switch to pivot steering. This allows you to setup a skid steering rover to turn on the spot in auto mode when the angle it needs to turn it greater than this angle. An angle of zero means to disable pivot turning. Note that you will probably also want to set a low value for WP_RADIUS to get neat turns.

PIVOT_TURN_RATE.Description: Desired pivot turn rate in deg/s.

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: RC channel to use to reset to last flight mode after geofence takeover.

RTL_SPEED.Description: Return-to-Launch speed default.  If zero use WP_SPEED or CRUISE_SPEED.

SPEED_MAX.Description: Maximum speed vehicle can obtain at full throttle. If 0, it will be estimated based on CRUISE_SPEED and CRUISE_THROTTLE.

STICK_MIXING.Description: When enabled, this adds steering user stick input in auto modes, allowing the user to have some degree of control without changing modes.

SYSID_ENFORCE.Description: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: The identifier of the ground station in the MAVLink protocol. Don't change this unless you also modify the ground station to match.

SYSID_THISMAV.Description: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network
SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle

TELEM_DELAY.Description: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

TURN_RADIUS.Description: Turn radius of vehicle in meters while at low speeds.  Lower values produce tighter turns in steering mode

SAIL_ANGLE_IDEAL.Description: Ideal angle between sail and apparent wind

SAIL_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Mainsheet loose, angle between centerline and boom. For direct-control rotating masts, the rotation angle at SERVOx_MAX/_MIN; for rotating masts, this value can exceed 90 degrees if the linkages can physically rotate the mast past that angle.

SAIL_ANGLE_MIN.Description: Mainsheet tight, angle between centerline and boom

SAIL_HEEL_MAX.Description: When in auto sail trim modes the heel will be limited to this value using PID control

SAIL_LOIT_RADIUS.Description: When in sailing modes the vehicle will keep moving within this loiter radius

SAIL_NO_GO_ANGLE.Description: The typical closest angle to the wind the vehicle will sail at. the vehicle will sail at this angle when going upwind

SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.Description: Sailboat minimum wind speed to continue sail in, at lower wind speeds the sailboat will motor if one is fitted
SAIL_WNDSPD_MIN.DisplayName: Sailboat minimum wind speed to sail in

SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.Description: The sail boat will tack when it reaches this cross track error, defines a corridor of 2 times this value wide, 0 disables
SAIL_XTRACK_MAX.DisplayName: Sailing vehicle max cross track error

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

SCHED_OPTIONS.Description: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

SCR_DEBUG_LVL.Description: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

SCR_DIR_DISABLE.Description: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

SCR_HEAP_SIZE.Description: Amount of memory available for scripting

SCR_USER1.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER2.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER3.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_USER4.Description: General purpose user variable input for scripts

SCR_VM_I_COUNT.Description: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the console.

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL1_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL2_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL3_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL3_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL4_BAUD.Description: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

SERIAL4_OPTIONS.Description: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.

SERIAL4_PROTOCOL.Description: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

SERIAL_PASS1.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASS2.Description: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

SERIAL_PASSTIMO.Description: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

SERVO_DSHOT_ESC.Description: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

SERVO_DSHOT_RATE.Description: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

SERVO_RATE.Description: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

SERVO10_FUNCTION.Description: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

SERVO10_MAX.Description: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_MIN.Description: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO10_REVERSED.Description: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

SERVO10_TRIM.Description: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

SERVO_BLH_3DMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors
SERVO_BLH_AUTO.DisplayName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors

SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.Description: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.
SERVO_BLH_BDMASK.DisplayName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

SERVO_BLH_POLES.Description: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

SERVO_BLH_RVMASK.Description: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

SERVO_FTW_MASK.Description: Servo channel mask specifying FETtec ESC output.

SERVO_FTW_RVMASK.Description: Servo channel mask to reverse rotation of FETtec ESC outputs.

SERVO_ROB_POSMAX.Description: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_ROB_POSMIN.Description: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

SPRAY_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

SPRAY_PUMP_MIN.Description: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_PUMP_RATE.Description: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

SPRAY_SPEED_MIN.Description: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

SPRAY_SPINNER.Description: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

SR6_PARAMS.Description: Parameter stream rate to ground station
SR6_PARAMS.DisplayName: Parameter stream rate to ground station

SR6_POSITION.Description: Position stream rate to ground station
SR6_POSITION.DisplayName: Position stream rate to ground station

SR6_RAW_CTRL.Description: Raw Control stream rate to ground station
SR6_RAW_CTRL.DisplayName: Raw Control stream rate to ground station

SR6_RAW_SENS.Description: Raw sensor stream rate to ground station

SR6_RC_CHAN.Description: RC Channel stream rate to ground station

SRTL_ACCURACY.Description: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

SRTL_POINTS.Description: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL.  100 points consumes about 3k of memory.
SRTL_POINTS.DisplayName: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path

STAT_BOOTCNT.Description: Number of times board has been booted

STAT_RESET.Description: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

VISO_DELAY_MS.Description: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

VISO_POS_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VISO_POS_X.Description: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.
VISO_POS_X.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera X position offset

VISO_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.
VISO_POS_Y.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset

VISO_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.
VISO_POS_Z.DisplayName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset

VISO_SCALE.Description: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

VISO_VEL_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

VISO_YAW_M_NSE.Description: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

VTX_ENABLE.Description: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off
VTX_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not

VTX_FREQ.Description: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

VTX_MAX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

Bitmask.4: Add leading zero byte to requests

VTX_OPTIONS.Description: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.

VTX_POWER.Description: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

WENC2_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder 2 counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC2_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC2_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the second wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC2_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder sensor is connected

WENC_CPR.Description: WheelEncoder counts per full revolution of the wheel

WENC_POS_X.Description: X position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

WENC_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

WENC_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the center of the wheel in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

WENC_TYPE.Description: What type of WheelEncoder is connected

WNDVN_CAL.Description: Start wind vane calibration by setting this to 1 or 2

WNDVN_DIR_DZ.Description: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor
WNDVN_DIR_DZ.DisplayName: Wind vane deadzone when using analog sensor

WNDVN_DIR_FILT.Description: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_DIR_FILT.DisplayName: apparent Wind vane direction low pass filter frequency

WNDVN_DIR_OFS.Description: Angle offset when analog windvane is indicating a headwind, ie 0 degress relative to vehicle

WNDVN_DIR_PIN.Description: Analog input pin to read as wind vane direction
WNDVN_DIR_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane analog voltage pin for direction

WNDVN_DIR_V_MAX.Description: Maximum voltage supplied by analog wind vane

WNDVN_DIR_V_MIN.Description: Minimum voltage supplied by analog wind vane

WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.Description: apparent Wind speed low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_SPEED_FILT.DisplayName: apparent wind speed low pass filter frequency

WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.Description: Wind vane direction will be ignored when apparent wind speeds are below this value (if wind speed sensor is present).  If the apparent wind is consistently below this value the vane will not work
WNDVN_SPEED_MIN.DisplayName: Wind vane cut off wind speed

WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.Description: Wind sensor analog voltage offset at zero wind speed
WNDVN_SPEED_OFS.DisplayName: Wind speed sensor analog voltage offset

WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.Description: Wind speed analog speed input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p
WNDVN_SPEED_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog pin

WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.Description: Wind speed sensor analog temp input pin for Modern Devices Wind Sensor rev. p, set to -1 to diasble temp readings
WNDVN_TEMP_PIN.DisplayName: Wind vane speed sensor analog temp pin

WNDVN_TRUE_FILT.Description: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency, a value of -1 disables filter
WNDVN_TRUE_FILT.DisplayName: True speed and direction low pass filter frequency

Values.2: RC input offset heading when armed

WP_OVERSHOOT.Description: Waypoint overshoot maximum in meters.  The vehicle will attempt to stay within this many meters of the track as it completes one waypoint and moves to the next.

WP_PIVOT_ANGLE.Description: Pivot when the difference between the vehicle's heading and its target heading is more than this many degrees. Set to zero to disable pivot turns. Note: This parameter should be greater than 10 degrees for pivot turns to work.

WP_RADIUS.Description: The distance in meters from a waypoint when we consider the waypoint has been reached. This determines when the vehicle will turn toward the next waypoint.

WP_SPEED_MIN.Description: Vehicle will not slow below this speed for corners.  Should be set to boat's plane speed.  Does not apply to pivot turns.

WRC2_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC2_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain.  Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)
WRC2_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain

WRC2_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC2_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC2_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC2_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain.  Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC2_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum.  Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate
WRC2_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum

WRC2_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain.  Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC2_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

WRC_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable wheel rate control

WRC_RATE_D.Description: Wheel rate control D gain.  Compensates for short-term change in desired rate vs actual

WRC_RATE_FF.Description: Wheel rate control feed forward gain.  Desired rate (in radians/sec) is multiplied by this constant and output to output (in the range -1 to +1)
WRC_RATE_FF.DisplayName: Wheel rate control feed forward gain

WRC_RATE_FILT.Description: Wheel rate control input filter.  Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

WRC_RATE_FLTD.Description: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTD.DisplayName: Wheel rate control derivative frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTE.Description: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTE.DisplayName: Wheel rate control error frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_FLTT.Description: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz
WRC_RATE_FLTT.DisplayName: Wheel rate control target frequency in Hz

WRC_RATE_I.Description: Wheel rate control I gain.  Corrects long term error between the desired rate (in rad/s) and actual

WRC_RATE_IMAX.Description: Wheel rate control I gain maximum.  Constrains the output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate
WRC_RATE_IMAX.DisplayName: Wheel rate control I gain maximum

WRC_RATE_P.Description: Wheel rate control P gain.  Converts rate error (in radians/sec) to output (in the range -1 to +1)

WRC_RATE_SMAX.Description: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.
